types_of_studies.name: Case Study
types_of_studies.description: An in-depth examination of a single instance or event, such as a person, group, or organization, to explore its underlying principles or phenomena.

types_of_studies.name: Cohort Study
types_of_studies.description: A longitudinal study that follows a group of individuals who share a common characteristic or experience over time to observe outcomes and associations.

types_of_studies.name: Cross-Sectional Study
types_of_studies.description: A study that analyzes data collected from a population at a specific point in time, providing a snapshot of variables and their relationships.

types_of_studies.name: Longitudinal Study
types_of_studies.description: A research design that involves repeated observations of the same subjects over a period of time to detect changes and developments.

types_of_studies.name: Experimental Study
types_of_studies.description: A study where researchers manipulate one or more independent variables to observe the effect on dependent variables, often conducted in controlled environments.

types_of_studies.name: Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT)
types_of_studies.description: An experimental study where participants are randomly assigned to either a treatment group or a control group to evaluate the effectiveness of an intervention.

types_of_studies.name: Observational Study
types_of_studies.description: A study where researchers observe and record behavior or outcomes without manipulating variables, including case-control studies and cohort studies.

types_of_studies.name: Survey Study
types_of_studies.description: A study that collects data from a sample of individuals through questionnaires or interviews to gather information on various topics.

types_of_studies.name: Qualitative Study
types_of_studies.description: A study that explores phenomena through non-numerical data, such as interviews and observations, to understand experiences and perspectives.

types_of_studies.name: Quantitative Study
types_of_studies.description: A study that uses numerical data and statistical methods to quantify variables and examine relationships between them.

types_of_studies.name: Meta-Analysis
types_of_studies.description: A statistical technique that combines the results of multiple studies to identify patterns, discrepancies, or overall effects.

types_of_studies.name: Systematic Review
types_of_studies.description: A comprehensive review of existing research on a specific topic, following a systematic method to identify, evaluate, and synthesize relevant studies.

types_of_studies.name: Ethnographic Study
types_of_studies.description: A qualitative research method that involves the researcher immersing themselves in the study environment to observe and interact with participants in their natural setting.

types_of_studies.name: Clinical Trial
types_of_studies.description: A type of experimental study conducted to evaluate the safety and efficacy of medical treatments, drugs, or interventions in human participants.

types_of_studies.name: Field Study
types_of_studies.description: A research study conducted outside of a laboratory or controlled environment, often in natural settings, to observe phenomena in real-world contexts.

types_of_studies.name: Case-Control Study
types_of_studies.description: A study where individuals with a specific condition (cases) are compared to those without the condition (controls) to identify factors associated with the condition.

types_of_studies.name: Twin Study
types_of_studies.description: A study that examines the similarities and differences between twins to understand the influence of genetics versus environment on certain traits or conditions.

types_of_studies.name: Retrospective Study
types_of_studies.description: A study that looks backward in time, usually using existing records, to examine exposures or outcomes that have already occurred.

types_of_studies.name: Prospective Study
types_of_studies.description: A study that follows participants forward in time from a point of exposure or intervention to observe outcomes as they develop.

types_of_studies.name: Delphi Study
types_of_studies.description: A method for forecasting and decision-making involving rounds of anonymous surveys or questionnaires to gather expert opinions and reach a consensus.

types_of_studies.name: Action Research
types_of_studies.description: A participatory study that involves researchers working with participants to identify problems and develop solutions in real-time settings.

types_of_studies.name: Historical Study
types_of_studies.description: A study that investigates past events or conditions to understand historical developments and their impacts.

types_of_studies.name: Narrative Study
types_of_studies.description: A qualitative study that collects and analyzes personal stories or narratives to gain insights into individuals' experiences and meanings.

types_of_studies.name: Longitudinal Case Study
types_of_studies.description: A type of case study that tracks changes in a single case or a few cases over an extended period to understand development or progression.
